args: Two days after the Grissblum bombing...
And you say the man who will know about\nthe key to perdition is in this town?
M-my position among perditionists is but a\nlowly one, so I can't tell you a thing about\nthe key—but he is sure to know!
I'll lead you to him! No tricks!\nJust please don't kill me!
I have said nothing about killing you.\n...It appears I truly put some fear into\nyou last time.
You're still getting better, so be careful\nnot to push yourself too hard.
Excuse me, but are you Klaus, the former\nlibrarian of the Ilian Curia Archives?
Yes, though I'm well retired at this point.\nAnd who might you be, miss?
I am Alex, personal guard of the Grand\nPaladyn, and I come with questions.
The Church, is it? Hmm. I suppose that\nmeans you'll be asking about the\nScrolls of Perdition.
*sigh* All I want to do is enjoy what few\nyears I have left, but those blasted things\nseem determined to prevent it.
I have no interest in the scrolls. Instead,\nI wish to know of the ＂key to perdition.＂
I know not where you came to learn of that\nfoul notion, but I'll not speak of it again!
The key to perdition is a truth most cruel,\nnot a thing for idle curiosity! Now begone\nfrom this place and never return!
I am afraid I cannot do that;\nI have a friend to protect.
My friend's life is in danger because\nshe has something to do with the key\nto perdition.
And I would know the truth, that I might\nbe able to cut her free of such oppression.\nNow tell me what you know, I beg of you!
What is the name of this friend?
The tale you would hear is not one to be\ntold in the open. Come into my home.
W-well enough! Seeing as how my duty\nis fulfilled, I'll just take my leave...
Now then. You are aware of the\nScrolls of Perdition, yes?
They are ancient documents that state,\namong other things, that the Other is\nthe offspring of the Goddess Ilia.

Indeed—and that interpretation threw the
Church into disarray. However, that trouble
is nothing compared to what would happen
if the complete document were discovered.
The Scrolls of Perdition are but a portion\nof a larger text—one that has been kept\nhidden away from the world.

This document evidently records a truth
beyond the kinship of Ilia and the Other—
one which could upset the very
foundations of the world.
Afraid of what such a truth would mean,\nthose who discovered the Scrolls kept a\nportion of them and sealed away the rest.
So what, then, is the key to perdition?
It is that which will release the seal on\nthe remaining portion of the texts.
But this leaves questions yet unanswered,\nincluding the location of the full document\nand what, exactly, the key is.
However, the method for obtaining the\nkey has been passed down to a select few.
Apparently, the key can be obtained in\nexchange for the life of one maiden.\nAnd that maiden's name is...
She is likely not even aware of the cruel\nreality to which she has been burdened.

However, so long as there are those who
would seek the remaining portion of the
Scrolls of Perdition, this Elisanne's life
will remain in grave danger.
That is as much as I can say, child.\nI would suggest you hurry to your friend.
Though the truth she has been burdened\nwith may be cruel, a friend who cares\nfor her might still mean her salvation.
...Ah! Perhaps HE is the one who\nis targeting the maiden Elisanne!\nI must inform the young lady at once.
Back when I was an assassin, I went\nafter her as I was commanded.
Would you PLEASE listen?\nI have no quarrel with you!
I care not. Now hold still\nand prepare to die.
Between my indignation at her and my\nignorance of the burden she bore...
Oh, Elisanne. I am so sorry.
By Ilia, these wounds are so deep...\nWho did this to you?!
It was raining too much to play,\nGrandpa, so I... Huh? Who're you?
Are you Klaus's grandson?\nEr, listen... This here...
Guards! Guards, help! Come at once!
And with that, my promise to\nher is complete...
Ah! Perhaps that person there will take\nsome pity on a poor old man of a cloth.\nHo, friend! I am a traveling... Y-YOU!
You rose so far in the world with the\ndirector's help, and now look at you.\nWell, THIS is your lucky day, honeybun!
That fool Alex is going to come to you\nseeking a certain bit of information.

When she does, I want you to take her
to the former librarian of the Ilian Curia
Archives. And when there's a chance,
you'll go to the man and...
Oh, what a frame job I did to Alex!\nThis is certain to guarantee me a\nfat reward from the director.
I get my revenge AND I'll be able\nto regain my former status!
This is proof I am loved by the goddess!\nO Ilia, I love you as well!
Well, ain't that just sweet as sugar?
A murderer isn't worthy to receive\nthe Goddess's blessing.
And now to put the finishing touch on\nthis grand show. Time to see her!
